wgl_fort.name: Warangal Fort (వరంగల్ కోట)
wgl_fort.story: The fort was the capital of the Kakatiya dynasty. The intricate stone gateways, known as Kakatiya Kala Thoranam, are an architectural marvel and have become a symbol of Telangana.

comments.text: The detail on the arches is incredible!

chowmahalla.name: Chowmahalla Palace (చౌమహల్లా ప్యాలెస్)
chowmahalla.story: This was the seat of the Asaf Jahi dynasty and the official residence of the Nizams of Hyderabad. Its name means 'Four Palaces'. The grand Khilwat Mubarak hall is breathtaking.

golkonda.name: Golkonda
golkonda.story: Golconda is a fortified citadel and ruined city located on the western outskirts of Hyderabad, Telangana, India. The fort was originally built by Kakatiya ruler Pratāparudra in the 11th century out of mud walls

ramappa_temple.name: Ramappa Temple
ramappa_temple.story: Ramappa Temple, also known as the Rudreshwara Temple, is a Kakatiya style Hindu temple dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva, located in Palampet village, Mulugu district, Telangana, India. It is 15 km from Mulugu, 66 km from Warangal, 209 km from Hyderabad.
